meta_description: Just outside of Annapolis, MD, Historic London Town and Gardens reveals the "lost" colonial town of London and shares a garden sanctuary on the South River.
hours_text:
## Visitor Information

Hours of Operation:

Tuesdays - Saturdays, 10:00am - 4:00pm

Admission

Your admission goes directly to the London Town Foundation, a 501c3 non-profit (Tax ID: 52-1396159), that cares for and shares the museum and gardens.

  * Members are free ([Become one today!](https://www.historiclondontown.org/member))

  * Adult - $11

  * Senior (62 & up) - $10

  * Youth (4-17) - $5

  * 3 and Under - Free

  * $1 Discount for AAA members (adult and senior admission only)

Note: Paying with credit card is preferred. If paying with cash, we do not accept bills over $20.

​

​

​Library Pass Program for Maryland Residents

London Town has partnered with the Anne Arundel County Public Libraries to offer free 4-person family passes. These passes can be checked out from any AAC Public Library. [Learn more.](https://www.aacpl.net/library-of-things/historic-london-town-and-gardens)

​

Museums for All

London Town is proud to be a part of this national program that allows up to 4 people free admission by showing your Photo ID and EBT card. [Learn more](https://museums4all.org/for-visitors/).

​

Reciprocal Admission

London Town is a part of the [North American Reciprocal Museum Association](https://narmassociation.org/) as well as the [American Horticultural Society](https://ahsgardening.org/) to offer reciprocal admission. You can see the list of participating museums [here](https://narmassociation.org/members/) and participating gardens [here](https://ahsgardening...

collections_text:
Plan your

visit

[Read More ](https://www.historiclondontown.org/visit)

## See what's happening  
at London Town!

There's something for everyone at the Historic London Town & Gardens!

[Upcoming Events](https://www.historiclondontown.org/event)

LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE

Cozy Concert 

January 19, 2026  
5:30pm - 6:30pm  

If you are looking to bring some cheer to the long winter nights ahead, join us for a Cozy Concert at Historic London Town & Gardens! Sip on a warm drink (tea anyone?) and settle in for a concert in the William Brown House tavern room where every seat is the best in the house. The Folk Villains return with their soulful bluegrass and folk music. Cost: London Town Members, $19, Non-members $21.  

[>REGISTER TODAY!](https://tickets.historiclondontown.org/events/historiclondontown/2015373)

Guided Tours

Public Tours:  
(dependent on staff availability)

  * 45-min Historic Area & William Brown House tours: Fridays and Saturdays, 11am & 2:30pm

  * 45-min Garden tour: Saturdays at 1:30pm

Private Group Tours​:

  * We offer private group tours of the historic area, gardens, or both—perfect for large groups or anyone seeking a more personalized experience. 

Self-Guided Adventure Lab​:

  * The Freedom Seekers Tour is an interactive journey using the Adventure Lab app (think geocaching for history) to explore stories at London Town.

[>MORE INFO](https://www.historiclondontown.org/adult-tours)​

How Tea is Made
